subtopic.sub_topic_name: The internet and the world wide web

learning_objectives.description: Understand the difference between the internet and the World Wide Web.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: The internet is the infrastructure. The World Wide Web is the collection of websites and web pages accessed through the internet.

learning_objectives.description: Understand what a Uniform Resource Locator (URL) is.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: A URL is a text address for a web page; it can include protocol, domain name, and page or file name.

learning_objectives.description: Describe the purpose and operation of HTTP and HTTPS.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: HTTP is used for web page communication; HTTPS adds security with encryption.

learning_objectives.description: Explain the purpose and functions of a web browser.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: Browsers render HTML to display web pages; features: bookmarks/favourites, history, tabs, cookies, navigation, address bar.

learning_objectives.description: Describe how web pages are located, retrieved, and displayed when a user enters a URL.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: Roles: web browser, IP address, domain name server (DNS), web server, HTML.

learning_objectives.description: Explain what cookies are and how they are used (session and persistent cookies).
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: Cookies are used for saving personal details, tracking preferences, shopping carts, and login information.
